document.discussion_title: Mining company shares can't be traded
document.topic_text: Bankrupt Golden mining company shares can't be traded, assets auctioned Denver Business Journal , KUSA 12:19 Atna Resources' Briggs Mine in Trona, California (Photo: ATNA RESOURCES PHOTO) DENVER BUSINESS JOURNAL - Atna Resources Ltd., which filed for bankruptcy protection in November, said its shares will no longer be traded and that its assets have been auctioned off. On Monday, the Golden mining company said its shares won't be traded after next week. "As the company has no present expectation that it will ever be in a position to remedy its failure to make its annual continuous disclosure filings, the company expects that (Canadian authorities), will proceed, within the next week, to issue a cease trade order prohibiting trading in the company's shares generally," Atna said in a statement. Read more from the Denver Business Journal: http://bit.ly/1Yk8ej6 . (© 2016 American City Business Journals.
